channel.title: Comments on: Lewis the Light, accident preventer

item.title: By: rss
item.dc:creator: rss
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://www.onbunkerhill.org/lewisthelight/#comment-22858">Alan F. Jones</a>.
Hello Alan,
I'm glad this odd character provided some insight for your researches. You might search in the digitized Herald archives for more on Lewis the Light and the Ark, starting with <a href="https://cdnc.ucr.edu/cgi-bin/cdnc?a=d&d=LAH19071211.2.90.7&srpos=1&e=-------en--20-LAH-1--txt-txIN-%22lewis+the+light%22+%22the+ark%22-------1" target="_blank" rel="noopener nofollow">this</a> explicit mention.
happy hunting, Kim
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Alan F. Jones.

Hello Alan,

I’m glad this odd character provided some insight for your researches. You might search in the digitized Herald archives for more on Lewis the Light and the Ark, starting with this explicit mention.

happy hunting,
Kim

item.title: By: Alan F. Jones
item.dc:creator: Alan F. Jones
item.description:
Dear Kim,
I have just come across your article on "Lewis the Light" and found it to of great interest as I research the George Edalji case here in the UK.
Do you know anymore details on Frank Sharp or, the "Ark" boarding house where the two lodged?
Best wishes,
Dr Alan F. Jones PhD
item.content:encoded:
Dear Kim,

I have just come across your article on “Lewis the Light” and found it to of great interest as I research the George Edalji case here in the UK.

Do you know anymore details on Frank Sharp or, the “Ark” boarding house where the two lodged?

Best wishes,

Dr Alan F. Jones PhD
